sources.snippet: Vulnerabilities NASDAQ Website Security Vulnerabilities Remained Open for Weeks After Alert. sources.title: Nasdaq Market Makers Antitrust Litigation - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Nasdaq Market-Makers Antitrust Litigation - class-action lawsuit initiated in 1996 alleging collusion amongst Wall Street traders. The class action alleged that NASDAQ market-makers set and maintained wide spreads pursuant to an industry-wide conspiracy. [1] Litigation took nearly four years and was eventually settled for $1.027 billion, which was the largest antitrust recovery up to that point.
